title: Build a Funding-Grade Business Plan in 3 Hours
subtitle: Transform your idea into a structured, investor-ready business plan in a single focused session
outcome: Transform your idea into a structured, investor-ready business plan in a single focused session. This Canada-wide online sprint is designed to help you build a plan that investors, banks, accelerators, and serious partners can actually evaluate—because it's clear, logical, and backed by credible assumptions.
deliverables: Funding-grade business plan structure (complete outline filled)
Clear problem → solution → market → model → go-to-market flow
Basic financial model skeleton (revenue drivers + cost assumptions)
Investor-readiness checklist (gaps + next steps to strengthen your plan)
Clean 1-page executive summary framework you can reuse

agenda.title: Kickoff + Outcomes
agenda.details: What "funding-grade" means, sprint rules, and what you'll finish today

agenda.title: The 1-Page Foundation
agenda.details: Customer, problem, wedge, and why now

agenda.title: Business Model + Assumptions
agenda.details: Pricing, revenue drivers, costs, unit economics logic

agenda.title: 12-Month Financial Skeleton
agenda.details: Forecast structure, break-even thinking, runway basics

agenda.title: Investor-Ready Checklist + Next Steps
agenda.details: What's missing, how to polish, and recommended next steps

whoItsFor: First-time founders who need a professional structure fast
Early-stage startups preparing for pre-seed/seed conversations
Professionals building a serious side business
Anyone applying to grants, accelerators, bank lending, or partnerships
whoItsNotFor: Anyone looking for a passive lecture with no hands-on work
Anyone not ready to make real decisions and document them in real time

faq.question: What will I walk away with?
faq.answer: You'll leave with a funding-grade business plan structure, clear problem-to-solution flow, 12-month execution plan, financial model skeleton, investor-readiness checklist, and a reusable 1-page executive summary framework.

faq.question: What should I prepare before the sprint?
faq.answer: Bring your idea in 1-2 sentences, any notes on your target customer, a rough price point (even a guess is fine), and have a Google Doc or Notion doc open so you can write live.

faq.question: Is this beginner-friendly?
faq.answer: Yes! This sprint is designed for first-time founders and early-stage startups. You don't need an existing business to attend—just an idea you want to develop into a structured plan.

faq.question: What's the difference between General Admission and VVVIP?
faq.answer: General Admission ($59.99) includes full access to the 3-hour live sprint, guided work blocks, Q&A, templates, and post-event resource pack. VVVIP ($399) includes everything in General Admission plus priority Q&A during the sprint and a private 1:1 plan review session after the event for focused feedback.

faq.question: What is your refund policy?
faq.answer: Full refunds available up to 7 days before the event. 50% refund for cancellations 3-7 days before. No refunds within 3 days of the event. See our full refund policy for details.

faq.question: Can I transfer my ticket to someone else?
faq.answer: Yes, you may transfer your registration to another person up to 24 hours before the event. Please contact us through our contact page to request a transfer.
